text: I am Rayan Chikhi, a researcher in
bioinformatics at The Institut Pasteur.

My team is working on
an ambitious project

which is to map
all the DNA on the planet

to identify future virus
threats proactively.

Today, only a tiny fraction, 
so approximately

0.01% of viruses present in the 
world are known.
Our initiative, IndexThePlanet,
aims to change this situation.

Actually, we are building 
a DNA database

that will be searchable
thanks to a search engine

and will allow researchers from
everywhere in the world
to follow and understand new pathogens.

We have done an analysis
of 20 petabytes of DNA data,

which is huge, and which
required a colossal computing capacity.

With the support of AWS,
we were able to reduce a task that would have

taken 3400 years on a 
normal computer to just 30 hours.

It is a pioneering project,
that inaugurates a new era

where massive genetic data,
cloud technology,

and also a bit of artificial
intelligence can transform biology,

and will advance
public health worldwide.
